name: areca
content:

(also areca palm, areca tree) a type of palm tree (= a tree that has a tall trunk with a mass of long pointed leaves at the top) that grows in tropical regions: This is a variety of areca prized for its yellow leaves and trunk. The red palm mite is a pest that affects coconut, areca, and date palms. She asked him to climb an areca tree to get some nuts.
plural areca (also areca nut) a nut that comes from an areca tree, a type of palm tree that grows in tropical regions: Pepper, areca, and cashew are spread out to dry on the patio. He collected areca nuts and put them in his sack. Synonym
betel nut
More examplesFewer examplesNow is the time the arecas start flowering.We pass through plantations of tall, thin areca palms, from which the dark red betel nut is harvested.The platform is decorated with palm leaf, mango leaf and areca flower. For an eight-hour day harvesting areca or pepper, they are given about 60 rupees plus lunch.Having cut all the areca from one tree, they move to the next one.
